list.name: Changes
list.comment: getNeibers method for movables is working - it can be used to detect where one can go.

task.summary: Default task
Pliki z projektu saperowego
Funkcja do rysowania obiektów w grze
Work in progress przy generatorze pola gry
Podstawowy generator mapy
Sterowanie work in progress
Sterowanie work in progress
I've refactored class names
I've added a new version of ascii images - it's harder than I thought to make them stick together.

I've refactored Cell.class: - deleted unused fields and methods. - Added linkedObject to link with game objects on a given field. - toString gets sprite from gameObject - (Old toString is here to stay until I migrate sprites to a new file).
I've added coordinates handling. Now they need to be stated in the cell initialization and it's possible for the gameObject to know coords of the linked cell.
Some testing regarding proper rendering and tiling. Seems ok for now. I've also added cell redraw directly to the gameObject constructor to make sure that every new object will be rendered.
I've started improving map generator. - I've added an extra req so that player will spawn near to the map edge. - I've added disclaimer to the game class about minimal size.
I've started improving map generator. - I've added an extra req so that player will spawn near to the map edge. - I've added disclaimer to the game class about minimal size.
I'm still not sure if it would be better to enforce setting starting cell for the object or not...
Zaimplementowałem coś na kształt słownika, żeby trzymać w nim (w jednym miejscu) grafiki używnae w grze. (Nie jestem pewien, czy to ma do końca sens, ale no na razie powinno działać)

Lol. I've spent ca. 2,5 hour debugging my code, because tile rendering was severely screwed somehow. Eventually it came out that my x and y parameters for JLabel are somehow forcing renders to display at absolute value of x & y, ignoring layout.
Renaming them did the trick.
Change in a JLabel size - looks good on my screen...
added gameObjects inits started sculpting the mapGen method
I wrote a method to get sprites by name for easier initialization of objects.
Player gen and enemy bases gen are ready for QA
I've added direction variable for movable class I've added name variable for to GameObjects which will be needed to ID them in pathfinding.
getNeibers method for movables is working - it can be used to detect where one can go.

MESSAGE.value: Pliki z projektu saperowego
Funkcja do rysowania obiektów w grze
Work in progress przy generatorze pola gry
Podstawowy generator mapy
Sterowanie work in progress
I've refactored class names
I've added a new version of ascii images - it's harder than I thought to make them stick together.

I've refactored Cell.class: - deleted unused fields and methods. - Added linkedObject to link with game objects on a given field. - toString gets sprite from gameObject - (Old toString is here to stay until I migrate sprites to a new file).
I've added coordinates handling. Now they need to be stated in the cell initialization and it's possible for the gameObject to know coords of the linked cell.
Some testing regarding proper rendering and tiling. Seems ok for now. I've also added cell redraw directly to the gameObject constructor to make sure that every new object will be rendered.
I've started improving map generator. - I've added an extra req so that player will spawn near to the map edge. - I've added disclaimer to the game class about minimal size.
I'm still not sure if it would be better to enforce setting starting cell for the object or not...
Zaimplementowałem coś na kształt słownika, żeby trzymać w nim (w jednym miejscu) grafiki używnae w grze. (Nie jestem pewien, czy to ma do końca sens, ale no na razie powinno działać)

Lol. I've spent ca. 2,5 hour debugging my code, because tile rendering was severely screwed somehow. Eventually it came out that my x and y parameters for JLabel are somehow forcing renders to display at absolute value of x & y, ignoring layout.
Renaming them did the trick.
Change in a JLabel size - looks good on my screen...
added gameObjects inits started sculpting the mapGen method
I wrote a method to get sprites by name for easier initialization of objects.
Player gen and enemy bases gen are ready for QA

Objects now should render properly as constructor and setter for gameObject also invokes setLinkedObject for linkedCell. Also, I've overdone it at first and managed to invoke set method loop & StackOverflow error. nice
I didn't want to write so many constructors so I've created a small function to append new sprites to the sprite array.
I didn't want to write so many constructors, so I've created a small function to append new sprites to the sprite array.
I've added direction variable for movable class I've added name variable for to GameObjects which will be needed to ID them in pathfinding.
getNeibers method for movables is working - it can be used to detect where one can go.
